Description: Moscow FSB headquarters shooting: Yevgeny Manyurov shot and killed 2 people and injured 5, after which he was shot dead by police.
Amur College Shooting: A student at the Amur college of construction opened fire on other students and then shot himself.
Gorny shooting: A conscript soldier opened fire on his colleagues during a change of guards.
Kerch Polytechnic College massacre: A student detonated a bomb and shot people and then shot himself.
Alexey Alexandrov killed 2 young girls on Mount Uktus with a self-made shotgun.
Alexander Novikov killed 5 people.
Kizlyar church shooting: Khalil Khalilov shot 5 people and wounded 4 others, after which he was killed by the police.
Marat Hajiyev shot 4 soldiers after which he was shot by other soldiers.
Hasan Abdulakhadov shot and killed 3 soldiers and wounded 2 others and was shot the next day.
Mass murder in Kratovo: Igor Zenkov killed 5 people and wounded 6 and then shot himself.
Mass murder in Redkino: Sergey Egorov killed 9 people.

Anton Vyacheslavovich Konev shot and killed 2 people in the FSB reception room and wounded another one and was killed by return fire.
Before the attack, he shot an instructor in a shooting range.
45-year-old K. Lunkov injured five people with a hunting rifle before committing suicide.
Georgy Borisovich Yudaev shot 4 people and wounded 3 and then shot himself.
Man injured five people at a nightclub
38-year-old Oleg Shishova shot and killed two people and injured seven others with a rifle
Grigory Gryaznov shot 3 people.
Domestic dispute escalated into a shooting, killing the local chief of police, Isa Yevloyev, and injuring four others
Four men were injured
Mass murder in Yegoryevsk: Ilya Aseev killed 5 people and was arrested the next day.
55-year-old Alexei Bychkov shot and killed one person and wounded three others
A group of friends opened fire at a nightclub injuring four people
Two men were killed and three were wounded during a dispute
Alexander Grigoriev shot and killed four people and wounded another with a hunting rifle

ru:??????, ????? ????-?????????: Bekir Nebiev shot 2 people and wounded 2 more and shot later.

Shooting in the Resurrection Cathedral of Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk: Stepan Komarov shot 2 people and injured 6 others.
2014 Moscow school shooting: Sergey Gordeev shot 2 people and wounded 1 other.
2013 Belgorod shooting: Sergey Pomazun shot 6 people and was arrested the next day.
2012 Moscow shooting: Dmitry Vinogradov shot 6 people and wounded one other.
Ramzan Aliyev shot 7 soldiers and wounded 6 others, after which he was shot dead by soldiers.
Soloti military training ground shooting: 2 conscripts from Tajikistan committed friendly fire, killing 11 people before being killed by return fire.
Izhevsk school shooting: Artem Kazantsev opened fire at his former school before committing suicide.
Denys Mashonsky shot four people and wounded another.
Veshkayma kindergarten shooting: Ruslan Rushanovich Akhtyamov fatally shot four people and wounded a fifth before committing suicide.
Moscow Multifunctional Center shooting: 45-year-old male shot and killed two people and wounded four others, reportedly after being told to put on a face mask.
Perm State University shooting: Timur Bekmansurov fatally shot six people at a university in the city of Perm before being apprehended by police.
Sergei Shinkevich fatally shot three people and wounded one.
Kazan school shooting: Ilnaz Galyaviev killed seven students and two teachers in Gymnasium No. 175 and injured 23 others before being arrested.
Anton Makarov shot 3 people to death and wounded 1 more before being arrested.
Dmitry Zakharov killed 3 people and wounded another before shooting himself.
Daniil Monakhov killed 4 people and wounded 2 more before shooting himself.
Sevastyan Putintsev shot 3 people to death before shooting himself.
Anton Franchikov shot 5 people to death.
Fazil Bahramov fatally shot 2 people and wounded another before shooting himself.
29-year-old man shot and injured three people during a road rage incident
ru:???? ????????: Denis Evsyukov shot and killed 2 people and wounded 7 others.

Vladimir Buldakhin shot 1 soldier and wounded 2 others.
2007 Balashikha shooting: Alexander Levin shot 4 people.
Sochi bombings#Perpetrators: Ilya Galkin shot 6 people and wounded another.

Almaz Shageev and Mikhail Sukhorukov killed 9 people and injured 2 others. Shageev killed Sukhorukov and then killed himself.

Ahmed Ibragimov shot 35 people and wounded more than 20 others in the Mikenskaya shootings.
